name: androstan-17-ol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3966
Reason: 17-Ol has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit for this compound is a steroid, which has a melting point around 100°C. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +10°C. The presence of two carbonyl groups (one from the ketone and one from the methoxy group) can form strong hydrogen bonds and rigidify the structure, contributing around +20 to +40°C for each carbonyl.
